Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Berne Patrick Moran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect. If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with KM, KLA or CJA.

records.descr: Transcript of judgment - Court of Appeals

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that this court takes no further action on the petitioner's motion.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, upon remittitur, the clerk of this court shall include with the notice of remittitur a copy of the petition to be construed by the circuit court as a Wis Stat. 974.06 motion.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition is transferred to the circuit court and that the circuit court shall construe the petition as a Wis. Stat. 974.06 postconviction motion.

IT IS ORDERED that, within fourteen days of the date of this order, the petitioner shall serve his petition for a writ of habeas corpus and supporting memorandum on the respondent and shall file a statement on service in this court indicating the date of service.  The respondent's time to file a response shall be fourteen days from the date of service.

IT IS ORDERED that, within fourteen days of the date of this order, the petitioner shall serve his petition for a writ of habeas corpus and supporting memorandum on the respondent and shall file a statement on service in this court indicating the date of service.   The respondent's time to file a response shall be extended to fourteen days from the date of service.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Moran's motion that this court serve the respondent is denied.

IT IS ORDERED that the respondent shall respond to the petition within fourteen days of the date of this order.    IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the petitioner's request that this court appoint counsel is denied.

IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals.  It is not a determination of indigency for any other purpose.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus filed
